news.title: Judge Orders Georgia to Switch to Paper Ballots for 2020 Elections
news.description: After identifying significant security problems with the state’s current election technology, a federal judge has ordered Georgia to stop using its outdated touch screen voting system.

news.title: State Attorneys General Said to Be Near Formal Investigation of Tech Companies
news.description: A bipartisan group of state attorneys general is reported to be on the verge of issuing antitrust civil investigative demands to Facebook, Google, Amazon, and Apple.

news.title: Legal Shield for Websites Rattles Under Onslaught of Hate Speech
news.description: A 1996 law has helped today’s tech giants thrive by protecting them from liability for user-created content, but the proliferation of online hate speech may change that.

news.title: Police Can Get Your Ring Doorbell Footage Without a Warrant, Report Says
news.description: New reports indicate that police departments around the country work with Amazon-owned home surveillance company Ring to request and obtain user footage.

news.title: Pai’s FCC Orders Cities and Towns to Stop Regulating Cable and Broadband
news.description: A new FCC order states that local governments may not regulate broadband offered over a cable system, prompting speculation that the agency’s decision will face legal challenges.

news.title: 22 Texas Towns Hit by Coordinated Ransomware Attack
news.description: Various departments within 22 small towns in Texas have been hit by a ransomware campaign from a single source, and both federal and state investigations are underway.
